|rad1chip2 = Atheros;AR5133; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |rad1n = 300/300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = USI MP-N-AT-02 rev 1.1 |rad2modif = Mini PCI |rad2chip1 = Atheros;AR5416; |rad2chip2 = Atheros;AR5133; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |rad2n = 300/300 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 2.4 or 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "MERU TRISULI DVT2.0" is silkscreened on the board. This device is using a... *[[Freescale]] MPC8347E ("MPC8347EVVAJFB", "533/333MHz", "QMZNL0738", "MALAYSIA") *and alternately, '''SK hynix''' HY5PS121621C FP-Y5 RAM, and '''Spansion''' S29GL128P90TFIR2 Flash This AP (and other '''Meru Networks''' APs) are designed to be used with a centralized AP controller. ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== It seems likely to be the following.. 
J2 [3.3] (RxD) (TxD) (GND)
{{/Serial info}} [[Category:English Documentation]]
